pullRequest.title: DBZ-137 Add doc section about database connection adapter
pullRequest.bodyText: Small update to DBZ-137 to add information about how to toggle between XStreams and Log Miner.

commit.message: DBZ-137 Add doc section about database connection adapter

afterCommit.message: DBZ-137 Add doc section about database connection adapter

commit.message: DBZ-137 Add commit_scn and log miner metrics

nodes.bodyText: Worth a mention in the section below (where the contents of source is described) that this is only present for LogMiner?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -708,6 +714,7 @@ Let's look at what a _create_ event value might look like for our `customers` ta
             "ts_ms": 1520085154000,
             "txId": "6.28.807",
             "scn": 2122185,
+            "commit_scn": 2122185,

nodes.bodyText: I think it's "LogMiner" (i.e. no whitespace), here and elsewhere.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1127,6 +1136,40 @@ The following shows an example JSON request for registering an instance of the {
 }
 ----
 
+[[selecting-the-adapter]]
+== Selecting the adapter
+
+{prodname} provides multiple ways to ingest change events from Oracle.
+By default {prodname} uses the XStream API but this isn't always applicable for every installation.
+
+The following example configuration illustrates that by adding the `database.connection.adapter`, the connector can be toggled to use the Log Miner implementation.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            We do encourage the use of the Log Miner implementation but we do not yet recommend its use in production as its still under active development.
          
          
            
            We do encourage the use of the LogMiner implementation for testing purposes and providing us with your feedback, but we do not yet recommend its use in production as its still under active development.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1127,6 +1136,40 @@ The following shows an example JSON request for registering an instance of the {
 }
 ----
 
+[[selecting-the-adapter]]
+== Selecting the adapter
+
+{prodname} provides multiple ways to ingest change events from Oracle.
+By default {prodname} uses the XStream API but this isn't always applicable for every installation.
+
+The following example configuration illustrates that by adding the `database.connection.adapter`, the connector can be toggled to use the Log Miner implementation.
+
+[source,json,indent=0]
+----
+{
+    "name": "inventory-connector",
+    "config": {
+        "connector.class" : "io.debezium.connector.oracle.OracleConnector",
+        "tasks.max" : "1",
+        "database.server.name" : "server1",
+        "database.hostname" : "<oracle ip>",
+        "database.port" : "1521",
+        "database.user" : "c##xstrm",
+        "database.password" : "xs",
+        "database.dbname" : "ORCLCDB",
+        "database.pdb.name" : "ORCLPDB1",
+        "database.out.server.name" : "dbzxout",
+        "database.history.kafka.bootstrap.servers" : "kafka:9092",
+        "database.history.kafka.topic": "schema-changes.inventory"
+        "database.connection.adapter": "logminer"
+    }
+}
+----
+
+[NOTE]
+====
+We do encourage the use of the Log Miner implementation but we do not yet recommend its use in production as its still under active development.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            ==== Log Miner Metrics
          
          
            
            ==== LogMiner Metrics

This actually this should just be done as an Oracle-specific extension of the streaming metrics instead of being its own context (similar to what we do for MySQL). Could you log a follow-up Jira issue for this (it's down right now)?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1155,6 +1198,69 @@ The *MBean* is `debezium.oracle:type=connector-metrics,context=streaming,server=
 
 include::{partialsdir}/modules/all-connectors/ref-connector-monitoring-streaming-metrics.adoc[leveloffset=+1]
 
+[[oracle-monitoring-streaming-logminer]]
+==== Log Miner Metrics
+
+The *MBean* is `debezium.oracle:type=connector-metrics,context=log-miner,server=_<database.server.name>_`.
